intro: Asplundia uncinata, commonly known as the hooked asplundia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiral-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Asplundia uncinata is typically found growing in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
